description:
With the way Smitten has expanded across the Bay Area, I imagine a good number of you (potentially) reading this have already tried them at this point.  Which, coupled with how this is the third one I've reviewed, probably makes this a little less useful.  Yet, redundant at this is, it's also entirely necessary.  Why's that, you ask?  Uhh...because it's ice cream, duh.  What kind of monster would I be if I DIDN'T write about them??

In all seriousness though, Smitten is pretty awesome.  Besides being the preeminent spot for "nitro ice cream" in the Bay Area (ice cream made with liquid nitrogen, which creates a creamier, icicle-less texture), their stuff is also just that tasty, simply enough.  On any given day, they usually offer (just) six different flavors - three or four of their staples (Vanilla, Fresh Mint Chip, TCHO Chocolate, and Cookie Dough with Pretzels & Chocolate Chips) along with a couple of flavors they rotate through.

While I normally give preference towards whatever seasonal flavors they happen to have (Mountanos Organic Coffee and Peaches & Bourbon, in this case), I decided instead to finally try their COOKIE DOUGH WITH PRETZELS & CHOCOLATE CHIPS ($5, small).  Though not nearly as good as their Lemon with Shortbread Cookie (my all-time favorite), it's easy to see why this is their most popular flavor.  Equal parts classic and unique, (slightly) salty and sweet, crunchy and creamy.  What's more, the texture was so smooth!

Beyond the ice cream, everything else about this Smitten is just like the others that I've been to - both good and bad(-ish).  The service/staff here is just as quick and friendly, and the ice cream is just as delicious, but the menu is also just as narrow (though they do offer some tasty looking sundaes).  Still, it's hard to argue against Smitten.  Other ice cream joints in SF might be better, and nitro ice cream may be losing its novelty, but there's no denying they still serve up some tasty ice cream!
author: Mike L.

description:
It's a cool concept. The flavors was ok .
Peach and Bourbon- liked the flavor combo but was a lil too sweet for me.
Watermelon- Husband loved it but I found it to sweet. 
I'm not crazy for it but I say you gottah try it at least once.
author: Lei K.

description:
The ice cream we had from Smitten Ice Cream in the Marina District was delicious. This is a California ice cream chain that differentiates itself from other ice cream shops by churning each order to order. The result is some of the freshest-tasting ice cream you'll probably ever eat. If you've ever had Thai-style stir-fried ice cream (or "rolled" ice cream) which is flash-frozen on anti-griddles, the idea here is similar; however, the mixing and churning process at Smitten is a lot less labor-intensive thanks to the company's patented machinery and equipment.

This location of Smitten opened on July 2, 2016 in the old Judy's Cafe space on Chestnut. In the 1930s and 1940s, this space was home to another ice cream shop, Eastman's Ice Cream. I'm sure Eastman's never foresaw a huge liquid nitrogen tank installed on the second level, overlooking the shop and connected to a network of touchscreen tablets and ice cream churners below. When you place your order at the register, it's automatically sent into Smitten's system and the creation process begins. At each station, ingredients are mixed and frozen in only about 90 seconds. It's fun to watch and sort of a mini spectacle. You'll see bowls and mixers spinning in different directions among billowy clouds of thick white smoke. It looks like some sort of crazy science experiment.

While the whole contraption looks really cool and technologically advanced, some might also perceive it as gimmicky. Fortunately, the ice cream is actually tasty.

When we visited, ice cream flavors included vanilla, peaches and bourbon, Mountanos Family organic coffee, cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips, TCHO 60.5% chocolate (TCHO is a fancy chocolate brand from Berkeley), and mint chip. These were sold at $5 for 2 scoops, $6 for 3 scoops, $7 for a half pint, and $11 for a full pint. (The peaches and bourbon flavor was $1 extra.) Daily scratch-made waffle bowls and cones were $1.50 each and toppings and sauces were $1 each. Examples included all-natural rainbow sprinkles, organic whipped cream, spiced oat crumble (new), and TCHO crispies and chocolate sauce. They also sold a root beer float for $6.50 and vegan pops for $4 each. The menu states they use organic milk and cream and fruits and vegetables from west coast farms.

The menu also featured a few sundaes which were ice cream, topping, and sauce combinations that Smitten put together. I tried a couple of these and a half-pint of cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips. They were:

* Choc Full O' Mint (two scoops, $10.50) - fresh mint chip ice cream, TCHO crispies, TCHO chocolate sauce, organic whipped cream, waffle bowl
* Dough My Goodness (two scoops, $9) - cookie dough ice cream, cookie dough, TCHO chocolate sauce, organic whipped cream
* Cookie Dough with pretzels and chocolate chips (half pint, $7)

In general, the ice cream was great. Of the items I tried, my favorite was the Choc Full O' Mint sundae. It had the best combination of flavor and consistency, from the smooth and refreshing mint ice cream to the light and crunchy TCHO crispies and house-made waffle bowl. The cookie dough ice cream was excellent as well. Personally, I could have done without the pretzels, but they were fine. All of the ice cream flavors were sweet, rich, and delightfully creamy. To me, taste and quality-wise, this ice cream was on par with other specialty and gourmet ice cream shops. So, to be honest, Smitten's elaborate setup doesn't really produce an ice cream that is head and shoulders above the competition, but it is still very good and quite satisfying. It's definitely worth a visit.

After tip and tax, I did think $13 was pushing it a bit for a two-scoop sundae, but then again, this is the Marina in San Francisco.

Service was quick.

At the time of writing this review, Smitten has six locations in the Bay Area (four in San Francisco) and three in Southern California. This location was the third San Francisco store. This is a fairly small shop with limited indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor seats are neat; they're custom-made out of milk crates. The inside of the shop has a modern and trendy vibe.
author: Daniel B.

description:
AMAZING flavors....I love the consistency and quality of SF ice cream and this one did not disappoint! The watermelon cream flavor is straight up d r e a m y. It's the only ice cream i've had that keeps surprising my taste buds with each bite, because it's such a unique taste...the fresh sweetness of watermelon with a rich creamy note isn't exactly like watermelon juice or gelato or anything you've had before. so 10 points for their creativity and kitchen finesse!!! Love that they make it right in front of you too. 
Smitten is the perfect name for this ice creamery because its storefront and ice creams keep you coming back for more!!!!
author: Shirley S.

description: Some of the best ice cream I ever had. And the waffle cones are delicious along with being freshly baked! Try it out asap
author: Aaron L.

description:
I've been to a few Smitten's and can say I'm not the biggest fan in terms of what you get for your buck, but this time I had a pretty good experience. 

We tried a new flavor called Blood Orange, and wow, it was fantastic.  I don't think the price tag of about $4 for a single scoop is still "fair", but overall I really enjoyed the ice cream.  Service was also a little bit better than usual. 

Overall, this isn't a place I would seek out, but if it's an area I'm at, I'm not against getting some.  Quality is great, but price is still a bit ridiculous.
author: Benny H.

description:
Decided to come here during my lunch break since i was craving something sweet and it was nice day on the day i came. 

I got the salted caramel flavor top with tcho chocolate sauce since it was i notice in the new flavor section. It had very little caramel flavor but it does have a lot of sweetness flavor. You can taste the salted flavor in the ice cream. I got the small cup size instead of the cone since i didnt want to eat too much of it. They do give you 2 scoops though. I thought their ice cream is in the pricy side. It Costs $5 for the ice cream in a cup and $1 for the chocolate sauce plus sf ordinance fee total of $6.30. They didnt charge any taxes. But their ice cream was still good

One thing thats cool about this place is that they use a machine where they make your ice cream fresh each time. So it is like they will make your ice cream until you order. You can actually see them use their ice cream machine while they make your ice cream
author: Julie N.

description: Deserves the hype. Some of the most unique and yummy ice cream I've ever had and certainly a leader in the SF ice cream/gelato arms race. See the price, swallow, buy it anyways.
author: Leslie T.

description:
I came to Smitten on the recommendation of a friend who called it some of the most delicious and creamy ice cream he'd had in his life. He even passed along a cute business card from them, which really sold it to me.

Upon walking into the store, I noticed that the same kind of stylish-yet-functional design applied to their interior. There's a big, easily-readable menu with their usual flavors and add-ons, for one. The lines are designed to allow the customer enough time to read the menu, and the queue for the finished product lets people see their liquid nitrogen ice cream as it's made in modified stand mixers. Kids and science geeks will especially love that.

If you've ever had Dippin' Dots, which is also manufactured with liquid nitrogen, you'll be familiar with the type of ice cream Smitten produces. It's just as creamy as my friend said, but lacks the heaviness of other ice creams made using traditional methods. This allows you to digest more scoops than usual, which I theorize is the reason why they give you two scoops as the smallest size. I split a strawberry mascarpone (mascarpone ice cream and strawberry coulis) with my significant other and found that it tasted like delicious New York cheesecake, complete with real chunks of berry. We weren't getting a bad deal, considering that we were in the Marina District and liquid nitrogen is pricey to get a hold of.

The downside is that ice cream melts very quickly without the subzero temperatures used to keep liquid nitrogen cool. Not fun if you're a slow eater. You also can't get more than one flavor in a cup, so if you want variety for an affordable price, you're better off going somewhere else.
author: Gwen W.

description:
Smitten has a limited but amazingly tasty selection with flavors that changes constantly. I had the Caramelized Banana Walnut flavor on their cone. An amazingly dense and flavorful ice cream. Loved the ice cream and the waffle cone. Didn't love the cone flakes at the bottom of the cone to fill it, because it was too sugary. 
My boyfriend had the tcho 65% chocolate with almonds and chocolate sauce. It was rich and filled with cocoa goodness
author: Demy T.

description: I visited two locations of this small chain in the San Francisco area, I would highly recommend trying them out. What they lack in a variety of flavors they make up for in the quality. The mint chip has a very clear flavor of fresh mint and it's amazing, the vanilla is rich and savory, and they have different toppings available if you choose.
author: Chris D.

description:
Ice cream chain that shakes up ice cream with nitrogen gas!

I like their Salted Caramel ice cream with chocolate bites all in between! Yum!

They have seasonal ice cream limited selections on the menu and fresh ingredients that is comprised from.

Sweet tooth for the liking here!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
High quality ice cream for a moderate price. Tried the cookie dough and it was pretty good. Flavor wise it is on par with other cookie dough flavors but I particularly loved how the bits of cookie dough were evenly distributed as opposed to being clustered.

Since they make their ice cream with liquid nitrogen, the main difference I noticed is that the ice cream feels lighter and easier to digest. It also melts significantly quicker than regular churned ice cream. Only downsides to this place are that they don't have a 1 scoop size (small is 2 scoops) and they have a limited flavor selection. Would definitely come back again if craving ice cream!
author: Brian G.

description: This ice cream was delicious! Maybe because I've never had ice cream made with nitrous oxide before, but this was the smoothest and creamiest ice-cream I've ever tried. While they don't have a lot of flavors, they do make each flavor batch individually in front of you and allow you to try samples! The chocolate ice cream with almonds was absolutely delicious, but I didn't like the joyous almond flavor- it tasted like it had dessert cherries mixed into it, not my favorite flavor. The Meyer lemon was really tangy and delicious- a must try for anyone who likes tangy ice cream. The early grey was really flavorful and while I didn't like it very much I could see how someone who loves earl grey would really enjoy that flavor. The staff who helped us were wonderful and kind. While the space is a little small, it's cozy and you can walk around eating your ice cream (perfect end to a date!)
author: Kulmeher D.

description: If you plan to have Smitten's, have it here. Less crowd, more parking, (probably) the same experience. The ice cream has a great texture, and they have add one that go well with the scoop. We had the watermelon, vanilla, and chocolate (I liked them in that order). Wish I could try different flavors but I understand why you can't (they churn in small batches after you've placed the order) and it's worth the sacrifice.
author: Sarmishtha S.

description: Delicious smooth and nitrous cold  with a variety of flavors walking distance in Marina district of San Francisco.  The strawberry buttermilk ice cream with TCHO and Prosecco Sauce was scrumptious!
author: Lorna F.

description:
Definitely smitten with this place! (yes, I know I'm not the first one to come up with that)

This is a great little ice cream shop that uses the liquid nitrogen method of making ice cream in small batches. They have 5 or 6 flavors. I went with the chocolate peppermint bark and it was suuuuper good. You get the nice and creamy texture of the nitrogen ice creams, but also a really good flavor and small chocolate chips for flavor. 

I liked how this flavor, in particular, wasn't too pepperminty... just enough to be refreshing. 

I'd definitely recommend this place!

Stay Cheerful ;)
author: Garen A.

description: I'm going to start off w saying I'm lactose intolerant. However this place was worth everything. The cookie dough pretzel was amazing and so creamy! Moly flavors that aren't too sweet and just right. I love how they make the ice cream too and mix it in in front of you.
author: Casie N.

description:
After dinner and wandering around The Marina, my friend and I decided to stop by for some ice cream. The place stayed busy with constant customers, yet the line was short enough and went by fairly quick. The ice cream here is made with liquid nitrogen, so you get this cool fog effect watching them make the ice cream. There are only a limited number of flavors, but all very solid ones to choose from --also helps with my indecisiveness.

I ordered the small size ($5) of cookie dough flavor in a waffle cup ($1.25). The waffle cup was super worth it --do it! For a small size, you get two scoops of ice cream which was perfect because I don't eat too much. I liked how there was chunks of cookie dough mixed into the ice cream, but didn't taste so much of the pretzel. Also tried some of my friends' earl grey flavor with chocolate chips and it was quite refreshing and just the right amount of earl grey flavor. Perfect little spot for some ice cream though!
author: Cindy Z.

description:
When I looked up places to go in San Francisco and Smitten Ice Cream came up I was like yes, ice cream who doesn't like ice cream. Then when I saw it was made with Nitrogen Gas, I thought this was so neat and cool and had to go see it. I have heard of ice cream being made this way but have never come across it so it was neat. 

After our late lunch at Pier 39, my husband and I caught a cab to Smitten on Chestnut to get ice cream. When we got there the staff was nice or at least the guy running the cash register was welcoming. The girl making the waffle cones and bowls didn't say anything when we walked in and the other girl with dreads didn't say much either and was behind the counter singing a Drake song that was playing. Anyway besides not having a more welcoming greeting the experience was good. 

My husband got plain Vanilla Ice Cream with Strawberry Sauce in a waffle bowl. I ordered Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Ice Cream with Pretzels. His ice cream was very good. Not much to talk about since it was plain Vanilla. The sauce itself was more on the tart side than sweet but still good. I didn't try his waffle bowl but I imagine it was good since he didn't say otherwise. My ice cream was very good. Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough was a childhood favorite and I still like it as an adult so I couldn't pass up on this flavor. Then when I saw Pretzels were added I was like this has to be a win. It definitely was. You get the bits of chocolate chip, cookie dough and pretzel in each bite. The pretzels added a salty touch. Overall good flavor. The texture of the ice cream is good. It's a little more firm and creamier than other ice creams. It wasn't bad just a tad different. 

Overall, it was cool to experience how the ice cream was made. The ice cream itself was good and we enjoyed our experience. Definitely try Smitten Ice Cream if you are a tourist and want some good ice cream.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
OMG love the Flavors and waffles. 
the only thing I have a but negative to say is the cashier was having a bad or busy day and was not the best at her customer service. Maybe it was that she had to work on Easter Sunday..
author: Maria D.

description: cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips. Y'all. This is where it is at! But... five bucks for a scoop?! Outrageous. Trust me, I'm all for the bougie hype of San Fran. Even the free has a price. But this is the single best scoop of ice cream (excluding gelato and boozy ice cream!) ive ever had. Doubting me? Go try it for yourself. You will not be disappointed. It is a scoop of creamy, perfectly balanced sweetness. this flavor though. It's almost like it was churned by angels.
author: Amanda P.

description: what a disappointment.  Aside from the ice cream tasting like processed milk product, the young woman at the cash register and her co-workers were about not only disinterested and unhelpful, but bored.  Surly, busy talking with each other, and "no you can't have a taste unless it's made" and "no you can't have two flavors" and only about six to choose from.  And not worth seven bucks a shot.  No one else in the store when we arrived--it was obvious it was our first (and last visit) but there was NO customer service.  the chocolate offering was supposed to have nutty and caramel combination, but neither flavor came through.  A waste of time, money, and that's off our list. forever.
author: susan j.

description:
Stopped into Smitten Ice Cream shop on a whim. Post lunch, time to get something sweet right? And with the heat wave hitting San Francisco this past Sunday, it was perfect timing to check out the goods here.

This shop is tiny. Three stools by the window and  a wooden bench that can be a cosy seat for three with packages. Outside there are also high tables with stools to perch on.

What I see is that Smitten offers flavors that serve as a base. The deal here is that they want you to pay for add-ons to soup up their scoops. Let me suggest to first-timers, like I was, that you try out their ice cream straight first. Just to get an idea if you like it.

Since I was there with my buddy B, we decided to share a regular ($6) cup of the Earl Grey ice cream with milk chocolate chips.  Sharing is caring, isn't it?

Since each ice cream order is made fresh, expect to wait a bit after you order. You can stand towards the front (since the shop is quite narrow) and watch the staff make their magic happen. The ingredients are poured or spooned into the metal container. The liquid nitrogen is introduced and with a whir, the ice cream is churned in minutes.

So how does Smitten measure up?

For me, ice cream breaks down into the following characteristics:

(1) Flavor
(2) Texture
(3) Uniqueness (a certain je ne sais quoi that offers a little verve)

Flavor - 3 stars
The earl grey ice cream is very subtle. This is a great flavor for someone who doesn't like overly cloying, in-your-face tasting sweets. It definitely appeals to the sophisticated palate. The milk chocolate chips were also very pleasant. Tasting this flavor was similar to tasting wine. You have to inhale to enjoy the subtle taste and take in the tea aroma.

Texture - 2 stars
I understand liquid nitrogen causes the ingredients to freeze super fast as compared to the regular ice cream process. But as I said to B, the consistency of Smitten ice cream falls between soft serve and true ice cream. The latter is typically solid because it's been frozen for some time. The product here is whipped up very quickly and doesn't have that solid consistency. Add to that a hot day, and the ice cream starts melting quite quickly; in turn you have to eat it quickly or end up having a cup of milk.

Uniqueness - average rating of 3
The liquid nitrogen process (only in the SF area would a techie process add to this factor) is a 4 for the novelty; whereas the ice cream flavors are 2 - hence an average of 3.

Seriously though, the ice cream here is not very memorable. It was okay and I would eat it again if I'm in the area. Guess I'm just not "smitten" with the place that I'd make an effort to come back.
author: Joanna T.

description: Decided to stop by this place after a friend of mine told me about their Blueberry Lavender Ice Cream. It has that hole in the wall feel. Good portions for ice cream and very tasty. Would definitely come back! :)
author: Valerie K.

description:
First time coming to Smitten and I was really impressed! There is a reason there's always a slight line to get in, but it's well worth it.

They use nitrogen gas to make their ice cream which makes it incredibly smooth and tasty!
author: James D.

description: A really fun spot for some cold ice cream.  It's cool to watch them make the ice cream from scratch. However, there is not a lot of flavor options and most of them are really unique with lots of mix-ins. Personally, I love this but it's not everyone's thing. And the serving size is a little small.  I would recommend checking out because the ice cream really is great!
author: Ece K.

description:
As an ice cream fanatic who loves brands like Honeymoon, McConnell's, Three Twins, and Jenis (and yes preferably in that order) this stuff always gets PRIME kudos.

Came here after lunch a few Sundays ago, and I can only say I was impressed. The design of the whole room was welcoming and friendly staff made it easy to pick and order my favorite flavors.  

Besides the $$$ price which matches the area, I'm unsure of why this place is getting serious hate, but I had a solid experience. Got the creme fraiche ice cream with pear caramel in a waffle cone and it was AMAAAAAAZZZZZZINGGGGGGGG!!! SOOOOOOOOOO CREAMY and just the right balance of soft and firm. The worker who helped coach me through my order was definitely a cool ice cream junkie and explained all the flavors (only 4 that day) simply and confidently. Great job gurl!

Would definitely be coming back when I'm in the mood (which is like forever).
author: Daniel O.

description:
I actually made ice cream using liquid nitrogen when I was a kid, #humble brag ;] , so when I stumbled upon this place I had high expectations. Though this tiny shop has a cool factor, as evident in the long lines wrapped all the way around the corner on a hot summer's day, the ice cream itself is just falling a little short. 

First of all, it is HELLA sweet. I realize that sensitive to sweetness varies by person, so to give you a measuring point: do you drink Starbucks' caramel latte with whipped cream? If yes, ignore my post and go get your sugar high. Do you find undiluted cranberry or apple juice (packaged in the liter bottles sold in grocery stores) too sweet as a drink? If yes, then satisfy your ice cream craving somewhere else. 

The flavors I tried: earl gray tea and honey comb. I find the favors too subtle and overpowered by dairy. I'm not lactose intolerant but I could feel the massive amount of heavy cream/butter coating my mouth, throat, and stomach, which was unsettling to say the least. Do not feed this to your children, they will have a heart attack at the age of 9.
author: Tata X.

description:
This location reminded of Melrose Ave in LA. Great ambience. Small and simple shop, and considering how small the shop is it had good inside and outside seating. 

If you can't get a seating... you're only half a mile away from palace of fine arts, a mile away from Ghirardelli Square and 1.5 miles away from Fisherman's wharf. So if you wanna take a walk, take that walk. :)

Ice creams tasted alright.. Mediocre. Got the earl grey with chocolate chips and I've had better.
author: Ji Eun L.

description:
Delightful, little ice cream shop.  There's only enough seating for about 10ish people inside, with some outdoor seating, to accommodate a few more couples or small groups.  

The ice cream itself is amazing, so smooth and creamy, the best ice cream I've had in a while.  The serving size is reasonable for the price.  I ordered the earl grey flavor, with caramel drizzle and tcho crisps.  The flavor combination was perfect, and I loved how the relatively bitter tcho crisps contrasted with the mild sweetness of the ice cream.  

The ambiance of the place reminded me of the hip, and cute ice cream parlors in Portland, Oregon.  The staff was also really friendly and nice.

I'm definitely going to spread the word to friends and be a returning customer.
author: luxe o.

description: We didn't get what we ordered and it was kinda expensive or whatever... ice cream was good tho
author: Macy Q.

description:
Freshly made cones was awesome! Cookie dough was really good, but the toppings were eh, kinda pricey for sliced almonds, and they werent really toasted either.

Small spot, but has a bathroom and a few seats inside and outside. 

Wish they had more flavors, I've had similar type of ice cream made by LN...
author: Minerva L.

description: It's funny...I'm not into soft ice cream and was hesitant...BUT so glad I tried their ice cream! The process is pretty cool- they pour liquid nitrogen in with the ice cream into a mixer. My favorite ice cream flavor is the TCHO chocolate in a waffle cone. Their waffle cones are pretty damn good...not sweet, with just the right crunch.
author: Vanessa O.

description:
OH MAN. CAN YOU SAY YUM...EEEEEEEEEEEE.

So I have to admit, I'm not that adventurous when it comes to my ice cream-- which is why I'm so happy that they have THEE MOST DELICIOUS CHOCOLATE ICE CREAM I'VE EVER HAD. Imagine the creamiest creamy cream ice cream. Yup. That sounds good doesn't it. It's dangerous that this place is right near my home. Highly suggest trying their other flavors, their menu is really creative with a unique combination of flavors. Enjoy!
author: Sarah M.

description: Had to get my ice cream fix.  I had the vanilla and strawberry sauce on a cone.  For the size small it was $7 and worth every bite!!  Service was a bit slower than normal guess there was not a line.  Need to go back to try other favors!
author: Stephanie C.

description: It's strange seeing the reviews so harsh for this Smitten versus others as I found this Smitten to be pretty consistent to the one in Hayes Valley. I ordered a cookie dough w/ pretzels & chocolate chip. It's nitrogen ice cream so they make it on the spot for you. They also offer different flavors based upon the season. The consistency is quite firm, but the best nitrogen ice cream in the area!
author: Kristen L.

description: Loved this ice cream. Made by the serving in cool mixers.  I had passion fruit and roasted dates.  Delicious.
author: Steve B.

description: Delicious! They have great flavors, and I settled on blood orange with pistachio cookies. It was perfectly sweet and fruity. It's creamy and has a terrific dairy taste. I've had homemade ice cream before that was made with liquid nitrogen, but it tasted more like a frozen treat than ice cream. This would be a fun place to take kids so they can watch the process.
author: Ha D.

description:
Ice cream was great. Service very bad. Employees are very rude and with a attitude of "don't care" while ordering and serving. 
The ice cream on the other hand was good.

They need to improve customer service.
author: Romulo H.

description: Definitely one of the best ice creams I've ever had. We got the cookie dough ice cream mixed with pretzels and chocolate chips and it was to die for. All the ice cream is mixed fresh right in front of you which is really cool to watch as well. They had only about 5 flavors available that day (chocolate, vanilla, and some more adventurous flavors like jasmine green tea and passion fruit) made with local ingredients in season at the time. Will definitely be returning next time I'm back in the city!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Thank you for keeping it REAL! All natural ingredients make a difference in taste and health. 

I was so disappointed that salt and straw uses additives like tapioca and carrageenan. 

I'm happy I can take my kids to smitten, a healthy and clean ice cream shop. Next best thing to homemade. Keep up the good work.
author: T W.

description:
I've been to Smitten's before, but the one in Hayes Valley. Smitten's hasn't disappointed me yet. This specific location gives you 20% or 25% off if you use Apple Pay. Its not much, but its still something. Since this one is right Chestnut parking will be hard, but good luck to you!

The two guys at the register who helped my friend and I out were super nice & described the different flavors really well. I even ended up buying a pint of tcho chocolate for home =)

I got the tcho chocolate with tcho crisps & chocolate syrup. Talk about chocolate over load, but definitely worth it.
author: Vangielynne P.

description: Delicious ice cream!! So creamy I could eat it all day. And the liquid nitrogen part is pretty cool :)
author: Janki P.

description: Anyone who gives this establishment anything less than five stars is an unreliable source. I am from Portland, Oregon home of salt and straw ice cream and SMITTEN is better. Yes, I said it. The cookie dough with pretzel and chocolate chip is absolutely amazing and should be consumed in copious amounts.
author: Natasha O.

description:
2 stars might seem kind of harsh. This review is simply reflective of my personal preference for how ice cream tastes.

I had the cookie and dough with chocolate chips and pretzel bits. The texture was thick (as opposed to loose and icy) and creamy, which I found ideal. I couldn't extrapolate too much of the flavor mostly because of how sweet it was. It was a punch of sugar that for me, masked the intricate, unique flavors of what I imagine would have been salty pretzel pieces, sweet (or better yet bittersweet) chocolate chips, and smooth cookie dough.

Service was a little slow despite it being a quiet night.
author: Cici T.

description:
I came here on a weekday during my lunch hour and there was no one waiting, which is a plus. I'm assuming it's because they just opened. 

I came here with my coworker and he got the classic vanilla ice cream. And he said it was delicious. So if a classic flavor is delicious, that means it's a great ice cream place because you can't go wrong with a vanilla flavor. Haha. I ordered a earl grey with chocolate chip and it's probably best earl grey ice cream I ever had. Although I haven't had too much earl grey ice cream in my life. Haha. The flavor of it was very strong, which is great then just tasting like plain ice cream. 

Also, the way they make the ice cream was very neat because they use liquid nitrogen which is different than other ice cream stores. So it gives you a show while you're waiting to get your ice cream. I would say it does take a little bit longer for your ice cream to come out. I believe we probably waited for 5mins to get our ice cream. 

Minus one star of the price. The ice cream does cost some $$$. But overall, I would probably want to come here if I want a nice treat to myself and experience the epicness of them making it. Haha
author: Christine H.

description:
Smitten was even more amazing than the hype promoting this fine establishment!  
Went in on the second day of their opening & the staff was offering samples of their -made from scratch -ice cream  outside on ChestnutStreet.  The menu offers suggestions as to flavor mixing & chose to have a 2 scoop toasted almond/ earl grey mix. A bit of a wait, & a bit pricey... But so Anazing!!!
author: Stacey C.

description:
Still don't get so-cal people thinking this is the best thing ever. 

This place might be your cup of tea but it's really for the hipsters: let's face it. 

But this location is definitely better than los altos, but still a little below mediocre. 

However for two of the four of us: it really hits the spot for them (both from so-cal), and two of us from the bay: one thought it wasn't bad, pretty good, but wouldn't really go here again.

The salted caramel was good, a little bitter for me. However for my friend: he said it was super sweet.

The guy at the front likes to fish for his tips: very disingenuous.
author: Lilian L.

description: The liquid nitro ice cream was great. Had the blueberry lavender. My son had vanilla and niece the Tcho chocolate. Nice smooth consistency and very friendly staff.
author: Darren N.

description:
I went with caramel and Tcho chocolate drizzle.  It was neither caramelly or chocolatey.  Disappointed that I wasn't blown away.  This place is overhyped.  You must come with low expectations to leave with a smile.

Next time, I'm marching up the hill to say hi to Swensons.
author: Amy J.

description: Tried their almond ice-cream with coconut macaroons and chocolate matzo, apparently it was only a Passover special. It was really good.Husband and I got a small and shared but we were wishing we had gotten something bigger. The ice cream making process was actually a bit longer than I expected but it was interesting to watch. Staff was friendly and helpful.
author: Beth M.

description:
I would say this shop was more for the instagram than for anything else (I know, I can't believe I'm actually admitting this). 

It was definitely cool watching them make it in front of you but I wish they gave me a heads up when they made mine. I was too busy looking around that I missed them making my Salted Caramel ice cream. I'm glad I went with the smallest size though since the rich flavors definitely get a little tiring after a few bites. I would even venture out to say that a small would probably be good enough for two people. 

You should come to check out how they make their ice cream and all the little options they have to add a little variety to your decision.
author: Jackson S.

description:
Sorry to give this place only a 2! Star rating but there are several reasons 
Staff super slow - like in slow motion. Not sure how they would ever handle a crowd? 
Limited options for flavors
Expensive for what you get
No samples 
Can only get one flavor 
And the combo we ordered was only partially delivered.  Ordered the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips. The girl only added cookie dough. No pretzels or chocolate chips. Too much trouble to ask so we left. Super sweet and tasteless 
I probably will not visit this location again. 
Sorry but an honest appraisal of this business.
author: Lynette J.

description: This ice cream place is one of those shops where everything is aesthetic in there so it convinces you to buy something so you can get a nice picture. Well this is the way I think so I knew I had to try this place at least once to get my picture. The interior is simple with a big smitten sign lit up high on the wall. The menu is simple with five flavors to choose from(I think it's different flavor everyday) and the toppings/sauces. I went for the small scoop of classic vanilla in a waffle bowl with toasted almonds which totaled out to be $7. Smitten is great because they make your ice cream right in front of you in the ice cream machines with nitrogen so you know it's fresh! The ice cream definitely tasted better than regular ice cream where it didn't melt as quick and the toasted almonds gave it a nice crunch. The waffle bowl cone was really crunchy too, tasted amazing with the ice cream. Everything about this place is cute & nice, only complaint is that they don't have many options to choose from.
author: Lisa W.

description:
All of the one star reviews for this place are stupid!   This place is fun and delicious! Sure it takes a little time but good things come to those who wait.  

Family of 4 in and Family 4 happy people out.  

Btw- we are not hipsters.
author: Dale D.

description:
This is the best and only ice cream I will have anymore. 

It is the smoothest, richest ice cream, at least the chocolate is. 

The chocolate is the best. 

The rest of the flavors vary. Some are a little too ambitious. Some hit it spot on, like the Earl Grey. 

They have a cool delivery option (either on Caviar or Postmates) where you get three pints, a sauce, and topping for like $35 bucks. It comes in a temperature shielding very reusable bag.

Oh yeah. The chocolate is the best.
author: Cecil C.

description:
I rarely eat desserts for various reasons, but when walking through Chestnut it's always tempting to sneak in and then pretend like nothing happened.

The experience from the entrance to the last bite of a waffle bowl is delightful if not sinful.
author: Ilya K.

description: I was a little skeptical at first because I'm a traditionalist when it come to ice cream flavors, but holy moly this place is good. The cookie dough with pretzels was delicious, and watching it being made was pretty neat too. It is expensive, but so is everything in SF.
author: Katie Y.

description: Looking for a cool way to eat ice cream? Try Smitten....custom flavor a in a rotating schedule where you get personal ice cream made while you wait? How? With proprietary nitrogen processing technology. Tasty local Tcho chocolate is worth the calories.
author: Pradnya P.

description: Really good freshly made ice cream and waffle cones 20/10 would recommend and coming back!
author: Annabella A.

description:
This location needs a major upgrade in the customer service department. The flags have been raised (i.e. reviews below) so management team - please tend to this issue so us Marina peeps can really welcome this spot with open arms.

I love Smitten anything - never had a bad flavor yet. Hayes and Cali locations are legit and so worth going to for great tasting ice cream and experience but Chestnut needs to really step it up. You know something is wrong when the employees making the ice cream need to grab a spoon and taste it for themselves. You don't see this amateur action taking place at any other location. Cashiers could also lose the attitude and put on a smile. After all, you work at an ice cream place - something that brings EVERYONE happiness!

Help!
author: Joy A.

description: First and last time I will come here.. ice cream was  good but NOT for the price and the tiny tiny spoons. They were totally out of waffle cones and bowls....There were 4 girls working and all in there own personal conversation and being that it was our first time there it would have been nice to have a little more info about the ice cream and options.
author: Start D.

description: Wow. Small batch made to order. I had the Brown Sugar ice cream with cinnamon shortbread cookie pieces in it, caramel sauce and whipped cream in a waffle bowl. Honestly was the tastiest ice cream I have ever had.
author: Ellen K.

description:
Flavor/Decor, pretty similar to the Livermore location that I went to. 

Main reason for the lack of stars is the SERVICE. Ok here I go:

I walk in with a friend and we have never tried the Mojito or Salted Caramel flavor from Smitten, or ANY of the flavors for that matter, and there are no samples so obviously it was difficult to choose a flavor. She seemed playfully bothered at our indecisiveness but because of there being no line, I did not see it as an issue at all.

When she was handed my friends card, it would not slide because the magnetic reader was old or whatever but ANYWAY, she was like "Oh wow, you're going to make me type it in?" Playfully, so I let it slide. 

THEN, my friend did not tip her for whatever reason, to each their own so whatever right, she proceeds to say "You not gonna tip me?", I have worked at Starbucks and I would NEVER say something like that. That crosses the line, no matter how playful you say it. But it does not end there, she tells the lady who is making the ice cream to "SPIT IN IT". You are not funny...

There is a fine line between playful and rude and the lady crossed it!!!!! Very annoyed.
author: Megan L.

description:
Went here with some friends after dinner to get what I heard was killer ice cream.
The process of making the ice cream was really cool.

Pricing was meh..costlier than I expected.  But, you chug on because it's SF of course.
Flavoring was good.  I'm not an ice cream connoisseur by any stretch, but it's notable.

Minus 1 star: the music was BLARING on a Monday night.  I had to get close to my buddies to chat with them while waiting.

Minus 1 star: the girl behind the bar was screaming out names like roll call in homeroom.  Why? THE MUSIC WAS TOO DAMN LOUD!

Fix the above and you get your 2 stars back.
author: Christopher C.

description: Super delicious! The waffle cones are super sweet! And the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips with the brown sugar and caramel was bomb. Def gonna revisit this place again my next SF visit!
author: Monika O.

description:
I give a three star rating with the caveat that it's the best ice cream in San Francisco, which I don't say lightly. Anyone who knows me can verify that ice cream is my favorite food (truth). 

Smitten loses marks from me on a couple of (v important) points though:

1) only one flavor per individual serving, regardless of size (whyyyy), and flavors are limited
2) pricing is kind of ridiculous (of course bougie techy ice cream is like $5 for a small)
3) staff experience is generally aloof and lacks hustle

Those things aside, their ice cream is too creamy and delicious to comprehend so I keep coming back for the cookie dough pretzel goodness. Maybe some whipped cream... Waffle cone bowl...... Some Tcho krispies just for the thrill of it.... (omg)
author: Allegra W.

description:
Heard awesome things about this place- was super excited it opened in my neighborhood. Came here in the afternoon after a movie at the Presidio Movie Theatre. Ordered two ice creams- and they were out of cones. Very disappointed, not sure how an ice cream place runs out of waffle bowls and waffle cones (the only thing they offer other than paper bowls). 

We saw them making more cones and asked about them, but the girl working the register (named Meave) told us they were too hot to put ice cream inside. She didn't offer us an option to wait a few minutes and then order with a Coke. Not impressed with the service. Definitely not impressed with an ice cream store that runs out of cones.
author: Renee R.

description: The decor and trendy flavors are a way of attempting to mask the fact that you are being ripped off with the toddler size portions and astronomical pricing. Limited flavors limited sizes and your wallet with be extremely limited after visiting Smitten.
author: Brianna R.

description: Good fun and a clever concept. I liked how there wasn't an insane number of flavours to choose from and that everything was made (and frozen) in front of your eyes. I liked the built your own sundae idea where you can add toppings or sauces. The best part in my opinion was the music! I loved all the 80s tunes. Also great to see all the products used are super local with the milk for the ice cream coming from just across the bay.
author: Suz F.

description: After lunch nearby, we noticed a Smitten's store front and decided to check out the flavors.  I like cookies & cream so the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chip sounded good.  The ice cream wasn't anything special.  I would've like more cookie bits.  I'm not an ice cream person and I only wanted a taste hoping that my friend would finish the rest but I thought wrong.  Welp, getting a brain freeze is on my bucketlist so I downed the ice cream as fast as I could only to end up with a mouth freeze.  Not quite what I was going for but hey, sometimes you're stuck with something you don't want to eat but you just gotta shove it down your throat and pretend you like it.  Yeah, ice cream.
author: Linda N.

description: YUMO - A line out the door. Small establishment and not a lot of seating. I think it's worth the wait and it wasn't that long. Unique flavors for sure and great toppings. I had vanilla ice cream with a strawberry prosecco  syrup and chocolate crisp. The salted caramel flavor was DELISH to. If near one I would check it out and will be back if I am in the city again.
author: Shelly P.

description:
I've seen Smitten on "must try" ice cream lists for the past few years, so, as a self-proclaimed ice cream connoisseur, I was excited to see this location a few doors from the restaurant where a friend and I were lunching. The flavors were promising and the liquid nitrogen ice cream making contraption was very cool, but the end product? It was nothing to write home about. 

That said, I'm glad to have tried it once for novelty's sake, but I doubt I'll be back. I'll save my $8 for a couple pints of whatever from the supermarket.
author: marie M.

description: Expensive but absolutely delicious! Fresh nitrogen ice cream made right in front of you along with fresh waffle bowls... aces!
author: S B.

description:
Made our day such a great idea !!!
You can tell they really care !!!

Such attention to detail!!
author: Azikiwee A.

description: Definitely had a great experience with my son and friends here! I love how the ice cream was freshly made right before my eyes. They had amazing customer service and I told them about my son's nut allergies, and they were fully aware and carefully crafted the ice cream to assure that it was made without any nut ingredients. I truly enjoyed this place and highly recommend them!
author: Maliyah B.

description: I walked by this place and had heard of it so I decided to check it out. To be honest I wasn't even hungry or craving ice cream but I just loved the idea that they make it with liquid nitrogen right in front of you! It was fun to watch and really sets this place apart from others. Ice cream tasted good as well and definitely could tell it was made from good natural ingredients. A little lacking in variety at the moment. Not sure if that is something that will change in the future. All in all a solid ice cream place with a cool experience!
author: Angela Y.

description: The ice cream is good, but nothing unique or overwhelming.  They only had 6 flavors, 3 of which were basic Vanilla, chocolate,  and cookie dough. The specials were pumpkin,  earl grey and dirty horchata- which is a horchata mixed with coffee. I enjoyed the pumpkin,  but the coffee in the horchata made it bitter and not reflective of the true flavor. Despite my love of ice cream I left disappointed because I spent $20+ for 2 waffle cones with caramel. Guess I'm not used to an ice cream cone costing as much as a lunch plate.
author: Eric M.

description:
Went here for the first time after getting lunch on Chestnut.  Fun vibe on a Saturday afternoon.  I absolutely love that they pride themselves in being homemade, local, fresh etc. and you can really taste it!  The Waffle Cone is AMAZING.  Totally tastes fresh.

What I am yelping about specifically was their customer service.  After waiting over 10 minutes for my order (Small Vanilla in a waffle bowl with crispies and whipped cream), one of the girls came over to tell me the vanilla machine was broken.  I ordered Salted Caramel instead and when it was ready she gave me WAY more than I ordered plus a token for a free small ice cream.  THANK YOU!
author: Kasey D.

description: Sad to say this Smitten location continues to have really bad service. Seems very inexperienced kids are running the place, they can't (or have no desire to) manage a crowd, and they're actively eating behind the counter while there's a line out the door. Pretty sure that violates some sort of health code... They also got our order wrong. Hope they can pull it together because the ice cream is good.
author: Danielle R.

description:
To be quite honest, I haven't yet tried the ice cream here. However, I feel my two star is well-deserved as I did attempt to try it. However, my patience got the best of me after almost an hour of waiting in line in a rhythm similar to that of the GG bridge on a holiday weekend. 

Besides, doesn't "smitten" have a negative connotation with it?

Anyway, two star instead of one for the cool environment and ability to get a snapchat of them making someone else's ice cream if you just want to stop by
author: Ethan M.

description: Not impressed at all with this ice cream. While it was light & fluffy, it melted way too fast & was beyond expensive for the taste & experience. I will stick to my grocery store brands for better quality & half the price
author: Caroline J.

description:
No thank you, and here's why: 1) Lines are way too long, because, 2) service is bad.  Yes, they make everything to order, but they could still hustle while filling orders and move things along a little faster.  Did not appreciate their employee looking at her cell phone while I was trying to order.  3) It's overpriced.  8 bucks for a small cone with a topping.  No big deal if you're rolling in tech or real estate money, but there are still some people in this town who have to watch what they spend.  4) The ice cream ain't all that.  Swensen's and Bi-Rite, among others, are cheaper, and as good if not better, and they have better service and much better selection.  And they'll give you a sample if there's something you want to try before you order.  5) Do not appreciate getting hustled for tips.  The Mister and I have spent our lives in the service industry, and we overtip everybody.  (Helpful hint to the counter crew at Smitten: you'll see a lot more money in the tip jar if you focus your attention on your customers and not your cell phones.)

They are laughing all the way to bank at Smitten, and good for them, because clueless San Franciscans will stand in line and overpay for anything.  Can't believe we lost Judy's and got this trendoid mediocrity in its place.   We won't be back, but I'm sure Smitten will get along fine without us....
author: Catherine F.

description: I knew there was an ice cream shop on Chestnut in the Marina, and stumbled upon Smitten. I could tell it was something different just walking in. There were people making ice cream from scratch on the left from, what I was soon to learn, fresh preservative-free ingredients. I ordered the chocolate sundae in a waffle cup. It came with nuts and 4 inch high whipped cream and this amazing brown sugar sauce (which sounded terrible to me but turned out to be one of the best things in the bowl). I took my first bite and blurted out, "WOW!!!" One of the workers was watching me, and said, "Right?!!"  It was also the smoothest ice cream I could remember having (because they use the smallest ice crystals). I was enchanted by this treat, this place, and the wonderful staff. How could I have not  known about this place?! And there are more locations in SF, 1 in San Jose, and 1 in L.A. to turn my family and friends on to. I grilled Evan about it's history and processes, while being continually overwhelmed by each bite. I wish I could eat ice cream more often, but I have a new place to take visitors to wow them about the uniqueness of SF. I LOVE this place -- I am Smitten!!!
author: Peggi G.

description: Some flavors are a hit and some are a miss. My #1 right now is cookie dough (I hate cookie dough, but I love Smitten's cookie dough). I used to love Salted Caramel, but now I'm kind of over it. Usually if the flavors aren't appealing, I will default to vanilla even though that sounds super boring, they do it so well. The ice cream is super creamy here just how I like it. This is definitely one of my top fav ice cream places because I've been here often enough to try all the flavors and know which ones are amazing and meh.
author: Sandy T.

description: Go if you have a lot of time to kill. The line is ridiculously long. Even on a cold night. And because they have to make each order, that's an extra five minutes.  Staff kept checking their cell phones.  Maybe that's why it was so slow. Tastes great.  But not worth $5.
author: David S.

description:
Honestly I am shocked about the positive reviews for this place.

My girlfriend and I (I'm using my girlfriends yelp account) tried two of their flavors, the nectarine and salty caramel. Both were so bad we still can't un-taste them. They almost made my girlfriend and I dislike ice-cream as a whole. After my first couple bites I offered that the staff try my ice-cream to confirm it was made correctly, it was very sour and tasted like yogurt that had gone bad. Once you look past the literal smoke and mirrors magic trick of how they make their ice cream you find it to not be good at all.

This is my first negative review of anything on yelp.
author: Pauline L.

description: Delicious! Uniquely made ice cream with ever changing flavors. I love the cookie dough with the cookie dough topping. This week they featured a crème fraîche ice cream with pear caramel sauce and OMG it's easily one of the best desserts I've ever had! While I wish they had more seating, especially when the line literally goes out the door, I love this place and will definitely be a frequent customer!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I'm a texture junkie so this place has become my favorite ice cream. I don't like to mess it up with toppings or bits, just perfect smoothness. Enjoyed the root beer float too!
author: Deirdre M.

description: Hit and miss, except the only hit is the chocolate or cookie dough icecream. Different little spin on ice-cream (using liquid nitrogen to freeze) that's cool if you haven't seen it before.
author: Austin H.

description: The single fact I can't buy a pint of ice cream without queuing is a big fail. Seriously???
author: Nicole E.

description:
I wanted to knock this down to 3 stars because I got a 'regular' size ice cream in a waffle bowl with no other toppings and it was around $8

Kind of pricey, but it is SF, so if I just ignore the price, it was pretty good ice cream and fun to watch them make it.
author: max m.

description: Great ice cream! The flavors are amazing. The Ice cream is super creamy and fresh. The fact that they make it in front of you is awesome. Will be back.
author: Wil R.

description: I love smitten!  My favorite combo is the chocolate with spicy caramel sauce (in a waffle bowl).  It's my favorite place when I just NEED ice cream (good ice cream).
author: A H.

description: I've been going to their Hayes Valley and Pac Heights locations for years and was so happy when they opened on Chestnut in my hood. I always get the waffle cone and either vanilla or cookie dough with pretzels. So good!
author: K C.

description: Smooth, creamy, fresh!!! Get a waffle cone. This ice cream does not disappoint. New flavors all the time
author: Madeline S.

description: Okay ice cream and terrible service! The chocolate ice cream was not very flavorful, the mojito flavor was weird and the waffle cone was sloppy. Front register cashier was rocking a major attitude! My order was messed up and I was blamed for not paying for my cone, which I paid for and tipped $3 for $14 ice cream. Not worth the wait or the cost!
author: Tasha B.

description: I'm very passionate about ice cream, and this place does it right.  I had the cookie dough, pretzel and chocolate chip ice cream. It was delicious! A of the ingredients tasted fresh and the crispness of the pretzel was amazing. The next time I'm in the Bay Area I will be returning.
author: Jeremy L.

description: After I enjoyed my delicious ice cream, I walked outside, looked up at the building and said.... Wow. Just, wow. :)
author: P K.

description: The smoothest ice cream I have ever had! I had the TCHO 60.5% chocolate flavor and it was rich, but not over powering. A fun, quirky atmosphere, the best part is that you get to watch the ice cream be made using liquid nitrogen! It was really cool and the ice cream is amazing!
author: Becky B.

description: I've tried lots of ice cream places and after passing a certain level, they all are kinda hard to differentiate from each other. Most shops have trademark flavors to set them apart...humphery schlocomb has the corn flakes flavor, mitchell's has a lot flavors inspired by asian desserts. And while Smitten has fewer flavors--only 4 or 5 at a time (due to the way they make all the ice cream on demand)-- and costs a little more, I've got to say the end result is satisfying and pretty tasty. It may lack variety, but they focus on a few really interesting flavors each week and from what I've tasted, they know what they're doing. I've only tried the cookie dough pretzel and chocolate flavors, but that was all I needed to try to convince me to go back and recommend this place to anyone who enjoys ice cream. The cookie dough flavor has crunchy bits of chocolate and pretzel with chewy chunks of cookie dough. The waffle cone is a pretty good add-on too... it's crunchy and sweet and makes a perfect compliment to the creamy ice cream. With this place just down the street from work, I'll be tempted to come out for some ice cream after lunch more often.
author: Captain Z.

description: I went in a few days ago with a friend of mine, initially not planning to buying anything because I am lactose intolerant. Anyway, after walking in to look  at the menu, we were immediately engaged in conversation by an extremely enthusiastic associate. She gave us recommendations and described the flavor profiles in depth. She even swayed me, and I never eat ice cream because it wreaks havoc on my digestive system. Anyway, we ordered, and the cashier was just as enthusiastic about the waffle cones as the associate was about the ice cream. I opted out but did take a sample of the waffle cone, and it was delicious. Anyway, we both ordered the pretzel cookie dough flavor and it was very good. The price was a little steep, but I suppose we also pay for the novelty of the experience, so I am not going to quibble about it. An excellent atmosphere and cute decor in the store as well. BEST PART: no digestive distress! Crazy.
author: Anju O.
